Is the Black Chrome 50 APO's lens hood just poorly designed or am I dumb? /!/ Loving my new setup - even took some time off in a couple weeks to enjoy time at an Airbnb in the mountains to tinker and get familiar. But I'm just left scratching my head at this lens hood.

In the picture on B&H, it clearly shows that it clips on with the "large" side are outward, and the "Made In Germany" text the correct orientation should the screen of the camera be face down on a table. If I do this... the whole lens cap can very easily spin around the lens (does this constantly in just normal use... furthermore, it's VERY easily pulled off. And past that... then the lens cap doesn't work. The cap is too small.

&#x200B;

You can flip the lens hood around - and now the lens cap at least works! But the hood still spins AND now it covers up your aperture ring. 

This seems like... super obvious... but I'm struggling. Thoughts?
